revision.comment: Created page with "Possibly: The new pilot for the east coast of Scotland; giving a particular account of the tides, a description of the fishing banks, and appearance of the land from sea; al..."
revision.text: Possibly: The new pilot for the east coast of Scotland; giving a particular account of the tides, a description of the fishing banks, and appearance of the land from sea; also; a description of all the rocks, sands, shoals, channels, creeks, bays, harbours, &c. With Directions for conducting Ships in every Situation along this Coast. Accompanied with Four Charts. Done from an actual survey by Murdo Downie, a master in the Royal Navy, and lately of His Majesty's ship the Champion, on the Lieth Station. (London : printed for the author, by Daniel Bond, No. 4, Red Lion Court, Fleet Street...[1792]). http://library.st-andrews.ac.uk/record=b2496885~S1
